json_ref: TABLE_FILTER::Opt - Misc::Opt - Misc|Right of Contraction, Termination or Renewal::Right of Contraction, Termination or Renewal::Renewal/Extension::In Lease?
instructions:
You are given a single field: document_text. Your task is to determine whether the lease grants the tenant an explicit contractual right to renew or extend the lease term.

Output format:
- Output only a single value: “Yes” or “No” (case-sensitive). Do not include explanations or additional text.

Decision rules:
1) Count as “Yes” if the master lease (between landlord and tenant) or any lease amendment explicitly provides an option/right for the tenant to renew or extend the term (e.g., “Option to Extend,” “Option to Renew,” “Extension Option,” “Option Term(s),” “renewal right,” “right to extend/renew”). This includes options that are personal to the named tenant and options that require notice within a window (e.g., 9–12 months before expiration).

2) Count as “Yes” if an amendment to the lease explicitly confirms that a previously granted renewal/extension option remains in effect, or adds new renewal/extension options.

3) Do NOT count as “Yes” solely because of:
   - A holdover provision (e.g., month-to-month tenancy at expiry).
   - Rights of first offer/refusal on other space, expansion/shrink rights, relocation rights, early termination rights, or rent abatement.
   - A one-time extension already effected by amendment without any stated option/right for further renewal/extension (only treat as “Yes” if an option/right exists going forward).

4) When multiple documents are present, prioritize the master lease and its amendments. Ignore renewal/extension language found only in subleases, consents to sublease, or other third-party agreements unless they clearly amend the master lease to grant the tenant such a right.

5) If the only renewal/extension language appears in a sublease (e.g., between sublessor and sublessee) or refers to “Sublessor”/“Sublessee” rights and does not amend the master lease, answer “No.”

6) Ignore notices or commencement letters that merely restate term dates without granting renewal/extension rights.

Examples that should be “Yes”:
- “Tenant shall have two (2) options to extend the Term for five (5) years each.”
- “Option to Extend remains in full force and effect” (in an amendment).
- “Tenant has one (1) five-year renewal option…”

Examples that should be “No”:
- Only holdover month-to-month language.
- ROFR/ROFO to adjacent space.
- Sublease-only “Option to Renew” with no master lease amendment.
- A term extension via amendment with no option to extend/renew beyond that.

Your output must be exactly “Yes” or “No”.
